Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2008 12:12PM Yvon1 wrote: Thanks for you advice ladies.  The lidocaine cream really helped numb the skin & I hardly felt the radioactive tracer injections.  The placing of the 2 wires was a little more uncomfortable.  She hit the hematoma from the previous biopsies & warned me not to be scared of the blood.  Also, my Dr. prescribed 2 valium which helped me to chill.  The anticipation was so much worse than the procedures.
Posts.Title: SNB and wire localization Yvon1 Kathy_K

Posts.Content: Yvon1 wrote: Just recently diagnosed & having a lumpectomy on 6/12.  Worried about the wire localization & snb prep beforehand.  Can someone walk me through the process & share their experience?  Have been thru 3 biopsies, but it still has me scared.  Thanks so much. Dx 5/13/2008, ILC, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 1/10 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: SNB and wire localization Yvon1 Kathy_K
